pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [af48a45348](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22434/commits/af48a45348b8e6c4199974799004f9bb0487c278)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instAdd`
`+ instAddCommMagma`
`+ instAddCommMonoid`
`+ instAddCommSemigroup`
`+ instAddGroup`
`+ instAddMonoid`
`+ instAddSemigroup`
`+ instAddSubNegMonoid`
`+ instAddZeroClass`
`+ instDistribMulAction`
`+ instMulAction`
`+ instNeg`
`+ instSMul`
`+ instSub`
`+ instZero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/9b0dc145-3dc6-4d1d-8510-01448b0de431) for commit af48a45348b8e6c4199974799004f9bb0487c278.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/32b6338a-e7dc-41d4-8156-13e7ca5fa4cc/to/9b0dc145-3dc6-4d1d-8510-01448b0de431) against commit 2626910042c837ed53e1a8080cbcbdb514b7a2fb.

What's the motivation for these? `WithLp` is pretty useless for anything that is not an `AddCommGroup` right now, since we only get the norm with `NormedAddCommGroup`.

(the action ones below all look good to me)

I was dealing with `IsTopologicalAddGroup` with `WithLp`. I thought `inferInstance` should work creating an instance `IsTopologicalAddGroup (WithLp p (\a \times \b))`, but `WithLp` lacked instance related to `AddGroup`. So I added it, with several others which might be added in the future for similar reasons.
Can you give a more explicit example of what you were trying to do before that didn't work, and elaborate on why you had `AddGroup \a` and not `AddCommGroup \a`?

I was working with `toEuclidean` which contains the instance `IsTopologicalAddGroup`.
Therefore I tried to construct a following instance:
```lean4
instance
    [AddGroup α] [TopologicalSpace α] [IsTopologicalAddGroup α]
    [AddGroup β] [TopologicalSpace β] [IsTopologicalAddGroup β] :
    IsTopologicalAddGroup (WithLp p (α × β)) :=
  instIsTopologicalAddGroupSum
```
Of course `AddGroup` could be `AddCommGroup`, but it'd be nice to stick with the minimum requirements.

Perhaps worth noting that [`toEuclidean`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/InnerProductSpace/EuclideanDist.html#toEuclidean) is almost always a trap, and has little to do with `WithLp`. Were you looking for `WithLp.equiv` instead?

pullRequest.title: feat(Mathlib/Analysis/Normed/Lp/WithLp): Added more instances for `WithLp`
